Amritlal Mukundray Tiwari (Hindi: अमृतलाल तिवारी), popularly known as Kakka Ji or Sarpanch Sahab, was an Indian politician and social worker from Rewa district, Madhya Pradesh, India. He is remembered for his long tenure in local governance and his contributions to social and rural development.
Early life and background
Amritlal Tiwari was born in Gram Kapasa, a village located in the Semariya constituency of Rewa district, Madhya Pradesh. He belonged to an agricultural family and developed an early interest in public service and rural welfare.
Political career
* Growing up, he witnessed his grandfather and father's unwavering dedication to serving the people and social causes. This inspired Kakka Ji to dedicate his own life to helping the public.
* He was deeply influenced by his grandfather, Gopika Prasad Tiwari (a freedom fighter), and his father, Mukund Rai Tiwari, who passed away a few years after his birth.
* He started his political journey under the Influence of his area leader Pandit Yamuna Prasad Shastri.
* Elected to the Sarpanch of Gram Panchayat Kapasa at the age of 21 years only. At that time in Gram Panchayat Kapasa mostly 8 to 10 village included and Served as the Sarpanch of Gram Panchayat Kapasa for 28 consecutive years.
* Held the position of Nahar Panchayat Adhyaksh (Canal Panchayat President), contributing to local irrigation and agricultural improvements.
* Elected to the Society President.
* Elected to the Janpad Panchayat in the years 1977 and 1984 and after that also elected to the Member of Jila Panchayat.
* Joined the Indian National Congress around 1998–99 and continued working for regional development.
Tiwari was widely known for promoting education, healthcare, and infrastructure in rural areas, focusing on the empowerment of farmers and youth.
Legacy
Amritlal Tiwari is remembered as a dedicated grassroots leader in the District Rewa and Constituency Semariya - Constituency Sirmour- Constituency Rewa - Constituency Teonthar - Constituency Mangawan and Jawa Tehsile - Raipur Karchuliyan Tehsile and also in Sidhi district region. His leadership was marked by honesty, accessibility, and an unwavering focus on social justice. He was affectionately called "Kakka Ji" by the people, symbolizing respect and affection.
Personal life
Amritlal Tiwari lived in Gram Kapasa, Rewa district, Madhya Pradesh. He maintained a simple lifestyle and was respected by people across political and social lines.
